text:
This letter is from Paul and Timothy, slaves of Christ Jesus.
I am writing to all of God’s holy people in Philippi who belong to Christ Jesus, including the church leaders and deacons.
speaker: Narrator

text: May God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ give you grace and peace.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every time I think of you, I give thanks to my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever I pray, I make my requests for all of you with joy,
speaker: Narrator

text: for you have been my partners in spreading the Good News about Christ from the time you first heard it until now.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I am certain that God, who began the good work within you, will continue his work until it is finally finished on the day when Christ Jesus returns.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it is right that I should feel as I do about all of you, for you have a special place in my heart. You share with me the special favor of God, both in my imprisonment and in defending and confirming the truth of the Good News.
speaker: Narrator

text: God knows how much I love you and long for you with the tender compassion of Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: I pray that your love will overflow more and more, and that you will keep on growing in knowledge and understanding.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I want you to understand what really matters, so that you may live pure and blameless lives until the day of Christ’s return.
speaker: Narrator

text: May you always be filled with the fruit of your salvation—the righteous character produced in your life by Jesus Christ—for this will bring much glory and praise to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I want you to know, my dear brothers and sisters, that everything that has happened to me here has helped to spread the Good News.
speaker: Narrator

text: For everyone here, including the whole palace guard, knows that I am in chains because of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: And because of my imprisonment, most of the believers here have gained confidence and boldly speak God’s message without fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: It’s true that some are preaching out of jealousy and rivalry. But others preach about Christ with pure motives.
speaker: Narrator

text: They preach because they love me, for they know I have been appointed to defend the Good News.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those others do not have pure motives as they preach about Christ. They preach with selfish ambition, not sincerely, intending to make my chains more painful to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But that doesn’t matter. Whether their motives are false or genuine, the message about Christ is being preached either way, so I rejoice. And I will continue to rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I know that as you pray for me and the Spirit of Jesus Christ helps me, this will lead to my deliverance.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I fully expect and hope that I will never be ashamed, but that I will continue to be bold for Christ, as I have been in the past. And I trust that my life will bring honor to Christ, whether I live or die.
speaker: Narrator

text: For to me, living means living for Christ, and dying is even better.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I live, I can do more fruitful work for Christ. So I really don’t know which is better.
speaker: Narrator

text: I’m torn between two desires: I long to go and be with Christ, which would be far better for me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But for your sakes, it is better that I continue to live.
speaker: Narrator

text: Knowing this, I am convinced that I will remain alive so I can continue to help all of you grow and experience the joy of your faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when I come to you again, you will have even more reason to take pride in Christ Jesus because of what he is doing through me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Above all, you must live as citizens of heaven, conducting yourselves in a manner worthy of the Good News about Christ. Then, whether I come and see you again or only hear about you, I will know that you are standing together with one spirit and one purpose, fighting together for the faith, which is the Good News.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t be intimidated in any way by your enemies. This will be a sign to them that they are going to be destroyed, but that you are going to be saved, even by God himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: For you have been given not only the privilege of trusting in Christ but also the privilege of suffering for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: We are in this struggle together. You have seen my struggle in the past, and you know that I am still in the midst of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is there any encouragement from belonging to Christ? Any comfort from his love? Any fellowship together in the Spirit? Are your hearts tender and compassionate?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then make me truly happy by agreeing wholeheartedly with each other, loving one another, and working together with one mind and purpose.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t be selfish; don’t try to impress others. Be humble, thinking of others as better than yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t look out only for your own interests, but take an interest in others, too.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must have the same attitude that Christ Jesus had.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though he was God,
    he did not think of equality with God
    as something to cling to.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Instead, he gave up his divine privileges;
    he took the humble position of a slave
    and was born as a human being.
When he appeared in human form,
speaker: Narrator

text:
he humbled himself in obedience to God
    and died a criminal’s death on a cross.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, God elevated him to the place of highest honor
    and gave him the name above all other names,
speaker: Narrator

text:
that at the name of Jesus every knee should bow,
    in heaven and on earth and under the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
and every tongue declare that Jesus Christ is Lord,
    to the glory of God the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dear friends, you always followed my instructions when I was with you. And now that I am away, it is even more important. Work hard to show the results of your salvation, obeying God with deep reverence and fear.
speaker: Narrator

text: For God is working in you, giving you the desire and the power to do what pleases him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do everything without complaining and arguing,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that no one can criticize you. Live clean, innocent lives as children of God, shining like bright lights in a world full of crooked and perverse people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hold firmly to the word of life; then, on the day of Christ’s return, I will be proud that I did not run the race in vain and that my work was not useless.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will rejoice even if I lose my life, pouring it out like a liquid offering to God, just like your faithful service is an offering to God. And I want all of you to share that joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, you should rejoice, and I will share your joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the Lord Jesus is willing, I hope to send Timothy to you soon for a visit. Then he can cheer me up by telling me how you are getting along.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have no one else like Timothy, who genuinely cares about your welfare.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the others care only for themselves and not for what matters to Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you know how Timothy has proved himself. Like a son with his father, he has served with me in preaching the Good News.
speaker: Narrator

text: I hope to send him to you just as soon as I find out what is going to happen to me here.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have confidence from the Lord that I myself will come to see you soon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, I thought I should send Epaphroditus back to you. He is a true brother, co-worker, and fellow soldier. And he was your messenger to help me in my need.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am sending him because he has been longing to see you, and he was very distressed that you heard he was ill.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he certainly was ill; in fact, he almost died. But God had mercy on him—and also on me, so that I would not have one sorrow after another.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I am all the more anxious to send him back to you, for I know you will be glad to see him, and then I will not be so worried about you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Welcome him in the Lord’s love and with great joy, and give him the honor that people like him deserve.
speaker: Narrator

text: For he risked his life for the work of Christ, and he was at the point of death while doing for me what you couldn’t do from far away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatever happens, my dear brothers and sisters, rejoice in the Lord. I never get tired of telling you these things, and I do it to safeguard your faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: Watch out for those dogs, those people who do evil, those mutilators who say you must be circumcised to be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we who worship by the Spirit of God are the ones who are truly circumcised. We rely on what Christ Jesus has done for us. We put no confidence in human effort,
speaker: Narrator

text: though I could have confidence in my own effort if anyone could. Indeed, if others have reason for confidence in their own efforts, I have even more!
speaker: Narrator

text: I was circumcised when I was eight days old. I am a pure-blooded citizen of Israel and a member of the tribe of Benjamin—a real Hebrew if there ever was one! I was a member of the Pharisees, who demand the strictest obedience to the Jewish law.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was so zealous that I harshly persecuted the church. And as for righteousness, I obeyed the law without fault.
speaker: Narrator

text: I once thought these things were valuable, but now I consider them worthless because of what Christ has done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, everything else is worthless when compared with the infinite value of knowing Christ Jesus my Lord. For his sake I have discarded everything else, counting it all as garbage, so that I could gain Christ
speaker: Narrator

text: and become one with him. I no longer count on my own righteousness through obeying the law; rather, I become righteous through faith in Christ. For God’s way of making us right with himself depends on faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: I want to know Christ and experience the mighty power that raised him from the dead. I want to suffer with him, sharing in his death,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that one way or another I will experience the resurrection from the dead!
speaker: Narrator

text: I don’t mean to say that I have already achieved these things or that I have already reached perfection. But I press on to possess that perfection for which Christ Jesus first possessed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: No, dear brothers and sisters, I have not achieved it, but I focus on this one thing: Forgetting the past and looking forward to what lies ahead,
speaker: Narrator

text: I press on to reach the end of the race and receive the heavenly prize for which God, through Christ Jesus, is calling us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let all who are spiritually mature agree on these things. If you disagree on some point, I believe God will make it plain to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we must hold on to the progress we have already made.
speaker: Narrator

text: Dear brothers and sisters, pattern your lives after mine, and learn from those who follow our example.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have told you often before, and I say it again with tears in my eyes, that there are many whose conduct shows they are really enemies of the cross of Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are headed for destruction. Their god is their appetite, they brag about shameful things, and they think only about this life here on earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But we are citizens of heaven, where the Lord Jesus Christ lives. And we are eagerly waiting for him to return as our Savior.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will take our weak mortal bodies and change them into glorious bodies like his own, using the same power with which he will bring everything under his control.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, my dear brothers and sisters, stay true to the Lord. I love you and long to see you, dear friends, for you are my joy and the crown I receive for my work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now I appeal to Euodia and Syntyche. Please, because you belong to the Lord, settle your disagreement.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I ask you, my true partner, to help these two women, for they worked hard with me in telling others the Good News. They worked along with Clement and the rest of my co-workers, whose names are written in the Book of Life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Always be full of joy in the Lord. I say it again—rejoice!
speaker: Narrator

text: Let everyone see that you are considerate in all you do. Remember, the Lord is coming soon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t worry about anything; instead, pray about everything. Tell God what you need, and thank him for all he has done.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you will experience God’s peace, which exceeds anything we can understand. His peace will guard your hearts and minds as you live in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, dear brothers and sisters, one final thing. Fix your thoughts on what is true, and honorable, and right, and pure, and lovely, and admirable. Think about things that are excellent and worthy of praise.
speaker: Narrator

text: Keep putting into practice all you learned and received from me—everything you heard from me and saw me doing. Then the God of peace will be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: How I praise the Lord that you are concerned about me again. I know you have always been concerned for me, but you didn’t have the chance to help me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that I was ever in need, for I have learned how to be content with whatever I have.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know how to live on almost nothing or with everything. I have learned the secret of living in every situation, whether it is with a full stomach or empty, with plenty or little.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I can do everything through Christ, who gives me strength.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even so, you have done well to share with me in my present difficulty.
speaker: Narrator

text: As you know, you Philippians were the only ones who gave me financial help when I first brought you the Good News and then traveled on from Macedonia. No other church did this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even when I was in Thessalonica you sent help more than once.
speaker: Narrator

text: I don’t say this because I want a gift from you. Rather, I want you to receive a reward for your kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the moment I have all I need—and more! I am generously supplied with the gifts you sent me with Epaphroditus. They are a sweet-smelling sacrifice that is acceptable and pleasing to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this same God who takes care of me will supply all your needs from his glorious riches, which have been given to us in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now all glory to God our Father forever and ever! Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give my greetings to each of God’s holy people—all who belong to Christ Jesus. The brothers who are with me send you their greetings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the rest of God’s people send you greetings, too, especially those in Caesar’s household.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
speaker: Narrator
